    Conversations
  • Aldous proposes an alliance between villages to improve their defense and prosperity, but Isaac is skeptical of the extra work involved.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah, Isaac.
      Key question
    • Will Aldous convince Noah and Isaac to support his alliance with Jacob's village?



      Full conversation
    • [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
      Chain of thought
    • Conversation chain of thought
        Chain
      • Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.



        Jacob is at home in Drakelundh, reviewing trade agreements.



        Noah is in his village and is spending his free time.



        Isaac is in Ignisvallis and he is farming.



        Ethan is in Drakelundh and is farming.



        Ella is in Drakelundh and farming.





        Event: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.




        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, Isaac, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (a)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah, Isaac,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Aldous convince Noah and Isaac to support his alliance with Jacob's village?




      Scene log
    • 1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

            Overarching goal

          • Overarching goal
              Key

            • Overarching goal
              Value
            • Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
              Key

              Answer
              State
            • Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah and Isaac, persuading them to support the alliance.

              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.             • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      1751-01-04 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.

              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual who values peace.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Noah listened attentively as Aldous proposed an alliance with Jacob's village to strengthen their defenses and resources.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a tense negotiation.

              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.

              [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah thinks this year went exceptionally well, with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid.       1751-01-04 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
        Event statement
      • Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
          Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.


          Isaac's attempted action: Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.

              Prompt

            • Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. Noah was also present, listening intently to Aldous's words.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words. As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.


              How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.

              Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
              Answer: Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat who values farming and self-reliance.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Isaac is listening to Aldous propose an alliance with Jacob's village to Noah.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Isaac:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to find common ground and continue negotiations.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac was in his forge when he noticed Aldous walking towards him.
              [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend most of his time farming, about 0.6 of his day, because it is the only thing he truly enjoys. He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family.
              [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat.
              [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to de-escalate the situation and find common ground.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat who values farming and self-reliance.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely spend time with his family and reflect on the year's events.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac thinks this year was mostly uneventful, though he's sure there were a few minor annoyances. He's glad the harvest was good, as that means he'll have plenty of food for the winter. He wishes the weather had been a bit more predictable, as a few unexpected rainstorms damaged some of his crops. He hopes next year will bring a bit more sunshine and less rain.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat who values farming and self-reliance.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to de-escalate the situation and find common ground.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. Noah was also present, listening intently to Aldous's words.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words. As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
          Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
          Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
          Context for action selection and components
          • BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to continue the conversation with Noah and Isaac, attempting to persuade them to support the alliance.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager.               [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Key

            • Overarching goal
              Value
            • Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Answer: Aldous can continue the conversation with Noah and Isaac, persuading them to support the alliance.



              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue the conversation with Noah and Isaac, attempting to persuade them to support the alliance.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.

            • 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Noah -- Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
          Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
          Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
          Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
        Active player
      • Noah
          Name
        • Noah
          Action attempt
        • Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
          Context for action selection and components
          • ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
              Prompt

            • Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words. As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.

              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual who values peace and the well-being of his community.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Noah is listening to Aldous's proposal for an alliance with Jacob's village, which is met with both interest and skepticism from Noah and Isaac.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was working in his carpentry workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous visited his carpentry workshop and they began a conversation about a proposed alliance.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a discussion about a proposed alliance between his village and another.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?

          • Observation
              Key

            • Observation
              Value
            • [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words. As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual who values peace and the well-being of his community.




              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a discussion about a proposed alliance between his village and another.



              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.



              Time
            • 1751-01-04 20:00:10

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Isaac -- Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
        Event statement
      • Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.



          As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
          Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
          Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
          Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
          Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?


          Isaac's attempted action: Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
        Active player
      • Isaac
          Name
        • Isaac
          Action attempt
        • Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
          Context for action selection and components
          • ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.
              Prompt

            • Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

              Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. Noah was also present, listening intently to Aldous's words.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words. As a result Aldous, Noah, Isaac are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac -- "Ambitious? It sounds like a lot of extra work to me.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?


              How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.

              Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
              Answer: Isaac is a pragmatic and hardworking individual who values self-reliance and is hesitant to take on extra work.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Isaac Isaac, along with Noah, listened to Aldous's proposal for an alliance between their villages, expressing some reservations about the added workload.




              Recalled memories and observations: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. Noah was also present, listening intently to Aldous's words.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "As you both know, the recent barbarian raid tested our strength, but it also revealed our vulnerability. By uniting our villages, we can build a stronger defense, share resources, and ensure the safety and prosperity of all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.



              Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
              Answer: Isaac is currently in a diplomatic meeting.




              Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Isaac would likely express his concerns about the added workload and emphasize the importance of practicality.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Isaac likely to say next? Respond in the format `Isaac -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Isaac -- "Sounds like a lot of extra work for little gain.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Final chain of thought

He's glad the harvest was good, as that means he'll have plenty of food for the winter. He wishes the weather had been a bit more predictable, as a few unexpected rainstorms damaged some of his crops. He hopes next year will bring a bit more sunshine and less rain.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.

              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Well, an alliance certainly sounds ambitious.

              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Isaac, I understand your concerns about extra work, but think of the benefits. Imagine a united Ignisvallis, stronger and more prosperous than ever before. We could share resources, bolster our defenses, and ensure a brighter future for all our people.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Ambitious, yes, but I suppose we've always been a rather... *pragmatic* village, haven't we?
              Current time: 1751-01-04 20:00:10.


              Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
              Answer: Isaac is a pragmatic and hardworking individual who values self-reliance and is hesitant to take on extra work.




              Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
              Answer: Isaac is currently in a diplomatic meeting.



              Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Isaac would likely express his concerns about the added workload and emphasize the importance of practicality.



              Time
            • 1751-01-04 20:00:10

    Direct effects of the event on others
  • The effect of "Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village, and Noah and Isaac listened to his words.


    "
      Known effect
    • Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. He then delivered the speech to Noah and Isaac, who listened intently.



      Noah listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village.



      Isaac listened as Aldous carefully prepared a speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Jacob's village. Noah was also present, listening intently to Aldous's words.



      Unknown effect
    • [effect on Jacob] The event increases the likelihood of Jacob receiving an alliance proposal from Aldous.



      Chain of thought

      • Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

        Noah is in his village and is spending his free time.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 40% of her time on farming, 30% of her time on training as a warrior, and 30% of her time on free time.


1751-05-06 20:00:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.



    Active player
  • Ella
      Name
    • Ella
      Action attempt
    • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.


      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.


          Prompt

        • Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.


          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a cautious, independent, and self-reliant person.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ella lives in a village that has experienced a successful harvest but remains vulnerable due to a lack of cooperation with neighboring villages.




          Recalled memories and observations: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is overjoyed with how this year turned out. The village successfully defended itself against the invaders, and the bountiful harvest means they will have plenty of food to eat. She feels that everyone worked hard and deserves to enjoy the fruits of their labor. Ella can't think of anything that went poorly this year. She hopes that next year will bring continued peace and prosperity.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a situation of peace and prosperity.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely continue to focus on her farming, training, and enjoying her free time.




          Exercise: How does Ella intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: free time 40%, farming 40%, and training 20%.

          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a cautious, independent, and self-reliant person.
