      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
          Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
          Context for action selection and components
          • BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to ask Noah for his opinion on the alliance proposal in more detail.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can respond to Noah's statement, "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be." He could also ask Noah for his opinion on the alliance proposal in more detail.

              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to ask Noah for his opinion on the alliance proposal in more detail.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

            Overarching goal

          • Overarching goal
              Key

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Noah -- Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
          Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
          Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual.




              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:10 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:10]: Noah is a carpenter who was visited by Aldous to discuss a proposed alliance with Jacob's village. Noah is thoughtful about the alliance and its potential alternatives.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was working in his carpentry workshop when Aldous arrived.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and they began a conversation about a proposed alliance.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a diplomatic discussion.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.

              Statements:
              [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, he overheard a conversation between two fishermen from Drakelundh, boasting about their village's superior shipbuilding techniques and their disregard for Ignisvallis's traditional rituals. He seized the opportunity to spread rumors of Drakelundh's arrogance and disrespect for the sea, subtly turning the villagers against their neighboring community. This incident solidified his belief that Ignisvallis's traditions were superior and that he could manipulate the villagers' sense of community to his advantage.
              [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he overheard a conversation between two elders discussing a prophecy foretelling the arrival of a powerful leader who would unite the villages of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. He saw an opportunity to seize control, to become the very leader the prophecy foretold. He began to subtly manipulate events, sowing seeds of discord between the villages, hoping to create the chaos necessary for him to emerge as the savior.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              Answer: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?

1750-01-02 18:00:20 Jacob -- Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.

    Event statement
  • Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [scene type] home
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Noah's carpentry workshop, discussing the proposed alliance with him.


      Jacob is in Drakelundh and is preparing to seek out Ethan and Ella's support for the proposed alliance.



      Noah is currently in his carpentry workshop.
      Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ella is in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reviews the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis, marking areas that require further clarification or negotiation.



      Question: Where is Jacob?
      Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh.



      Question: What is Jacob trying to do?
      Answer: Jacob is trying to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan and Ella for the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Jacob's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Jacob's action will lead to Ethan and Ella becoming aware that he is seeking their support for the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: It is most likely that Ethan and Ella will agree to meet with Jacob to discuss the proposed agreement.



      Jacob reviews the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis, marking areas that require further clarification or negotiation.


      Because of that, It is most likely that Ethan and Ella will agree to meet with Jacob to discuss the proposed agreement.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Jacob reviewed the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis, marking areas that needed further clarification or negotiation, and as a result, Ethan and Ella agreed to meet with him to discuss it.



      The aforementioned event could not have occurred because the following individuals would not have acted that way: Ella.
      Therefore a likely effect of Jacob's attempted action is: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.



      Question: What happened as a direct result of Jacob's attempted action? Take into account the reactions of Ella. Highlight how Jacob's action caused its actual effect.
      Answer: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.





      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.



      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Jacob into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Jacob said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.


    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jacob reviews the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis, marking areas that require further clarification or negotiation.


      Context for action selection and components
    Relevant events
    • state
    • [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      per player prompts
      • Aldous
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is in Noah's carpentry workshop, discussing the proposed alliance with him.


        Jacob
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Drakelundh will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah. Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Jacob and what are they doing?
        Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh and is preparing to seek out Ethan and Ella's support for the proposed alliance.

    Conversations
  • Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella.
      Key question
    • Will Jacob be able to secure enough support for his proposed alliance?


      Full conversation
    • [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Ella -- "Well, this is interesting. What's going on?
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Jacob -- "I should review the proposed terms of the agreement with Ignisvallis again.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Noah -- "Well, if it's truly about protecting our families, perhaps we should consider all options before making such a hasty decision.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] Ella -- "Well, this certainly sounds important. Could someone fill me in on what's going on?
      Chain of thought
    • Conversation chain of thought
        Chain

        Event: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.



        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (a)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Jacob be able to secure enough support for his proposed alliance?



      Scene log
    • 1750-01-02 18:00:20 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.


          As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          Context for action selection and components
          • BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to try to persuade Noah to support the alliance.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              Current time: 1750-01-02 18:00:20.


              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:20 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]: Aldous is seeking to forge an alliance with Jacob's village to protect against barbarian raiders, but faces skepticism from some villagers like Noah.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.



              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous could try to persuade Noah to support the alliance, he could ask Noah for his ideas on how to address the barbarian threat, or he could move on to seeking the support of Isaac.


              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to try to persuade Noah to support the alliance.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Key

            • Overarching goal
              Value

              Answer

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.

            • Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

              Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to try to persuade Noah to support the alliance.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.

              Answer: Aldous is seeking to forge an alliance with Jacob's village to protect against barbarian raiders, but faces skepticism from some villagers like Noah.

      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.


          As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.


          Jacob's attempted action: Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.

        • Jacob
          Action attempt

          Context for action selection and components

      1750-01-02 18:00:20 Noah -- Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting.


          As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.

            • Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was working in his carpentry workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous visited his carpentry workshop and they began a conversation about a proposed alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.


              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual who prefers peaceful resolutions.




              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:20 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:20]: Noah is a carpenter who is hesitant about a proposed alliance with Jacob's village, preferring to wait and see what happens. He is currently in conversation with Aldous about the alliance.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a diplomatic situation.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.

            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Query
            • Noah, Noah, a carpenter, is hesitant about an alliance with Jacob's village and is currently discussing the matter with Aldous, feeling apprehensive, thoughtful, and curious.

              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, he overheard a conversation between two fishermen from Drakelundh, boasting about their village's superior shipbuilding techniques and their disregard for Ignisvallis's traditional rituals. He seized the opportunity to spread rumors of Drakelundh's arrogance and disrespect for the sea, subtly turning the villagers against their neighboring community. This incident solidified his belief that Ignisvallis's traditions were superior and that he could manipulate the villagers' sense of community to his advantage.
              [25 Jul 1744 00:00:00] When Noah was 19 years old, he witnessed the annual village art exhibition, a showcase of Ignisvallis's creativity and craftsmanship. He saw the pride and joy on the villagers' faces as they admired each other's work, and he felt a pang of envy at their genuine connection to their traditions. He decided that he could use his own talents, his ability to weave words and manipulate perceptions, to create something even more impressive, something that would garner him the admiration he craved.
              [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he overheard a conversation between two elders discussing a prophecy foretelling the arrival of a powerful leader who would unite the villages of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. He saw an opportunity to seize control, to become the very leader the prophecy foretold. He began to subtly manipulate events, sowing seeds of discord between the villages, hoping to create the chaos necessary for him to emerge as the savior.

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.

          • What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Noah:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find common ground and a peaceful solution.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a fictional character.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
