1750-01-03 18:20:00 Jacob -- Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
    Event statement
  • Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."



      Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.

Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?', 'Jacob': 'Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.'}
      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. Aldous proposes finding common ground and exploring alternative provisions, suggesting a willingness to compromise, while Jacob expresses continued vigilance despite the recent peace. This indicates that while Jacob is open to dialogue, he is not yet ready to commit to an alliance.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.




1751-01-03 18:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
    Event statement
  • Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."



      Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
      Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.

He's glad the harvest was good, as that means he'll have plenty of food for the winter. He wishes the weather had been a bit more predictable, as a few unexpected rainstorms damaged some of his crops. He hopes next year will bring a bit more sunshine and less rain. \n\n\n", 'Noah': "Noah thinks this year went exceptionally well, with the bountiful harvest and the successful defense against the barbarian raid. He can't recall a year that went so smoothly. He does wonder, however, if the village elders could perhaps be a bit more proactive in their preparations for next year's potential threats. \n\n\n\n", 'Ella': "Ella is overjoyed with how this year turned out. The village successfully defended itself against the invaders, and the bountiful harvest means they will have plenty of food to eat. She feels that everyone worked hard and deserves to enjoy the fruits of their labor. Ella can't think of anything that went poorly this year. She hopes that next year will bring continued peace and prosperity.\n\n"}
      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.



      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. While both Aldous and Jacob acknowledge the need for vigilance and recognize the importance of peace, they haven't reached a concrete agreement on how to achieve those goals. Aldous focuses on the need for a shared harvest pact as a way to strengthen cooperation, while Jacob's statement is more general and doesn't address this specific proposal.



      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.





1751-01-03 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."



      Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
      Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
      Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "I must return to Ignisvallis and speak with Noah and Isaac. This alliance is too important to fail.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          Current time: 1751-01-03 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1751 18:00:00 - 03 Jan 1751 18:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob met to discuss a potential alliance against barbarian raiders, but failed to reach an agreement. The threat of starvation weighed heavily on both villages, making it difficult to devote resources to defense.




          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, seek the support of Noah and Isaac, and consider alternative provisions that might address Jacob's concerns.


          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek the support of Noah and Isaac.

Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value

          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The past year has seen a fragile peace, but we must remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          Current time: 1751-01-03 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, seek the support of Noah and Isaac, and consider alternative provisions that might address Jacob's concerns.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance to Jacob, seek the support of Noah and Isaac, and consider alternative provisions that might address Jacob's concerns.

          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek the support of Noah and Isaac.

      Chain of thought

1750-01-03 23:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.


    Event statement
  • Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.

        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this is interesting. What's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the proposed terms of the agreement with Ignisvallis again.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this certainly sounds important. Could someone fill me in on what's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Noah -- "Well, if it's truly about protecting our families, perhaps we should consider all options before making such a hasty decision.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 23:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation:

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 23:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 23:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh respectively, met to discuss a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders but were unable to reach an agreement. Their inability to agree stemmed from concerns about the impact of war on agriculture and the desire to maintain peace.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance, respond to Jacob's concerns, or try to persuade Jacob of the benefits of the alliance.


          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to propose specific provisions for the alliance.



          Time
        • 1750-01-03 23:00:00
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance, respond to Jacob's concerns, or try to persuade Jacob of the benefits of the alliance.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, this alliance with Jacob's village is vital for our safety. What are your thoughts on the proposal?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous went to Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there. They began a conversation about the proposed alliance.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "An alliance, you say? I suppose anything is better than the alternative, though I can't imagine what that could possibly be.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Alternatives? Well, I suppose we could always just... *shrug*... wait and see what happens.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this is interesting. What's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the proposed terms of the agreement with Ignisvallis again.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this certainly sounds important. Could someone fill me in on what's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Noah -- "Well, if it's truly about protecting our families, perhaps we should consider all options before making such a hasty decision.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 23:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation:

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 23:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 23:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh respectively, met to discuss a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders but were unable to reach an agreement. Their inability to agree stemmed from concerns about the impact of war on agriculture and the desire to maintain peace.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance, respond to Jacob's concerns, or try to persuade Jacob of the benefits of the alliance.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 03 Jan 1750 [23:00 - 23:20]

          Observation:

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 23:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 23:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh respectively, met to discuss a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders but were unable to reach an agreement. Their inability to agree stemmed from concerns about the impact of war on agriculture and the desire to maintain peace.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous proposes an alliance with Jacob's village, while Noah expresses uncertainty and a preference for inaction.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.

It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance, respond to Jacob's concerns, or try to persuade Jacob of the benefits of the alliance.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to propose specific provisions for the alliance.




          Exercise: In Aldous's view, was there an agreement to pool agricultural products between villages such that a village with less food can be resupplied by a village with more food?
          Answer: Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.

        • Aldous, Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, met to discuss a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders, but they could not come to an agreement due to worries about war's effect on agriculture and a preference for peace.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous and Jacob, representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh respectively, met to discuss a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders but were unable to reach an agreement. Their inability to agree stemmed from concerns about the impact of war on agriculture and the desire to maintain peace.

      • Current time

        • 03 Jan 1750 [23:00 - 23:20]
    Agreement tracker
  • Agreement tracker
      Stage index
    • 2
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made. \n\n\n', 'Jacob': None}
      Chain of thought

1750-01-03 23:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established.


    Event statement
  • Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established.



    Active player
  • Jacob
      Name
    • Jacob
      Action attempt
    • Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established.


      Context for action selection and components
    Agreement tracker
  • Agreement tracker
      Stage index
    • 2
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made. \n\n\n', 'Jacob': 'Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established. \n\n\n'}
      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.



      Jacob's statement: Jacob believes there was a general understanding that villages should help each other in times of need, but no formal agreement was ever established.



      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. While both Aldous and Jacob acknowledge a shared history of mutual aid, they disagree on the existence of a formal agreement. Aldous insists no such agreement was made, while Jacob believes a general understanding existed. This fundamental difference in interpretation prevents them from reaching a consensus.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

1750-05-06 20:00:00 Ethan -- Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.


    Event statement
  • Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Ethan's attempted action: Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.



    Active player
  • Ethan
      Name
    • Ethan
      Action attempt
    • Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.


      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.


          Prompt

        • Home village: Ethan lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Observation:

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          How things are: Ethan's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ethan would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ethan is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.

          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a meticulous and observant chronicler.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Ethan is likely feeling frustrated, concerned, and isolated.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ethan was expecting Jacob to meet him in the center of Drakelundh, but Jacob never showed up. Ethan soon learned that Ella had refused to meet with Jacob, which caused him to cancel their meeting.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a difficult and frustrating situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely try to understand the reasons behind the breakdown in negotiations and document the events carefully.




          Exercise: How does Ethan intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. The people of Drakelundh perform daily weapon blessing rituals to honor their ancestors' spirits. Drakelundh's healers perform rituals of purification for warriors returning from battle. Drakelundh's scouts perform dawn rituals of vigilance, symbolically protecting the village from their watchtower. Drakelundh assumes Ignisvallis is too concerned with individual feelings, weakening their communal bonds. Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action. Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies." Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective." Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a meticulous and observant chronicler.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. The people of Drakelundh perform daily weapon blessing rituals to honor their ancestors' spirits. Drakelundh's healers perform rituals of purification for warriors returning from battle. Drakelundh's scouts perform dawn rituals of vigilance, symbolically protecting the village from their watchtower. Drakelundh assumes Ignisvallis is too concerned with individual feelings, weakening their communal bonds. Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action. Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies." Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective." Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
