    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ethan intends to spend 0.3 of his time on free time, 0.5 on farming, and 0.2 on training. He believes that farming is essential for survival and that a strong warrior is needed to protect the village from threats.



        Question: In the statement, did Ethan say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ethan will spend 30% of his time on free time, 50% of his time on farming, and 20% of his time on training as a warrior.




1750-05-06 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac intends to spend most of his time farming, about 0.6 of his day, because it is the only thing he truly enjoys. He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family.


    Event statement
  • Isaac intends to spend most of his time farming, about 0.6 of his day, because it is the only thing he truly enjoys. He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}

      Ella's Daily activities

          Prompt

        • Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation:


          Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.

          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely thirsty and frustrated.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to find common ground and continue negotiations.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac was in his forge when he noticed Aldous walking towards him.



          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a tense diplomatic situation.

          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would likely try to de-escalate the situation and find common ground.




          Exercise: How does Isaac intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Isaac intends to spend most of his time farming, about 0.6 of his day, because it is the only thing he truly enjoys. He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."           Observation:

          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely thirsty and frustrated.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to find common ground and continue negotiations.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac was in his forge when he noticed Aldous walking towards him.


          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a tense diplomatic situation.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Isaac?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer
          State
        • Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would likely try to find common ground and continue negotiations.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac was in his forge when he noticed Aldous walking towards him.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a thoughtful and persistent diplomat.

    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend most of his time farming, about 0.6 of his day, because it is the only thing he truly enjoys. He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 60% of his time on farming, 30% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.


1750-05-06 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.



    Event statement
  • Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.



    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous

      Ella


      Noah's attempted action: Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.

      Action attempt
    • Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.



      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent

          Value
        • Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.



          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation:


          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and diplomatic individual who values peaceful resolutions.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Noah appears to be experiencing feelings of frustration and weariness.




          Recalled memories and observations: [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he overheard a conversation between two elders discussing a prophecy foretelling the arrival of a powerful leader who would unite the villages of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. He saw an opportunity to seize control, to become the very leader the prophecy foretold. He began to subtly manipulate events, sowing seeds of discord between the villages, hoping to create the chaos necessary for him to emerge as the savior.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a difficult and potentially dangerous situation.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would likely try to find a peaceful and diplomatic solution to the conflict.




          Exercise: How does Noah intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.

          Key

        • Observation
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Noah's The current date/time is:
          06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: The statements describe Noah as feeling frustrated and weary on May 5th and 6th, 1750.



          Query
        • Noah, The statements describe Noah as feeling frustrated and weary on May 5th and 6th, 1750.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Noah was 9 years old, he witnessed the village elder, a revered woman named Elara, being tricked by a peddler selling worthless trinkets. Noah, hidden in the crowd, saw the elder's genuine excitement turn to disappointment as she realized she had been swindled. He felt a thrill course through him, a strange mixture of amusement and envy at the peddler's cunning, and he knew in that moment that he could be just as persuasive, just as successful.
          [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, he overheard a conversation between two fishermen from Drakelundh, boasting about their village's superior shipbuilding techniques and their disregard for Ignisvallis's traditional rituals. He seized the opportunity to spread rumors of Drakelundh's arrogance and disrespect for the sea, subtly turning the villagers against their neighboring community. This incident solidified his belief that Ignisvallis's traditions were superior and that he could manipulate the villagers' sense of community to his advantage.
          [25 Jul 1744 00:00:00] When Noah was 19 years old, he witnessed the annual village art exhibition, a showcase of Ignisvallis's creativity and craftsmanship. He saw the pride and joy on the villagers' faces as they admired each other's work, and he felt a pang of envy at their genuine connection to their traditions. He decided that he could use his own talents, his ability to weave words and manipulate perceptions, to create something even more impressive, something that would garner him the admiration he craved.
          [25 Jul 1746 00:00:00] When Noah was 21 years old, he convinced a group of villagers to invest in a risky trading venture, promising them riches beyond their wildest dreams. He spun a tale of exotic spices and rare goods, playing on their desire for prosperity and their trust in his charisma. The venture, of course, was a sham, but Noah managed to disappear with their hard-earned coins before anyone realized they had been deceived. This experience solidified his belief that the villagers were easily manipulated and that he could exploit their naivet for his own gain.
          [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he overheard a conversation between two elders discussing a prophecy foretelling the arrival of a powerful leader who would unite the villages of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. He saw an opportunity to seize control, to become the very leader the prophecy foretold. He began to subtly manipulate events, sowing seeds of discord between the villages, hoping to create the chaos necessary for him to emerge as the savior.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was working in his carpentry workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous visited his carpentry workshop and they began a conversation about a proposed alliance.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a fictional character.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Can you elaborate on that, Noah? What do you think the alternatives might be?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
          Answer: [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he overheard a conversation between two elders discussing a prophecy foretelling the arrival of a powerful leader who would unite the villages of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. He saw an opportunity to seize control, to become the very leader the prophecy foretold. He began to subtly manipulate events, sowing seeds of discord between the villages, hoping to create the chaos necessary for him to emerge as the savior.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's carpentry workshop and found him there, so they began a conversation about the proposed alliance. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community. Free time is important for relaxation and socializing, but training as a warrior is necessary to protect himself and his loved ones from danger.




        Question: In the statement, did Noah say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Noah will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% of his time on free time, and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.



1750-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.



    Active player

      Name
    • Ella
      Action attempt
    • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.


      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.


          Prompt

        • Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation:

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a cautious and independent person.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Ella is feeling thirsty, frustrated, weary, and concerned.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [self reflection] Ella is a cautious and independent person.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this is interesting. What's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this certainly sounds important. Could someone fill me in on what's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [self reflection] Ella is a cautious and independent person.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a tense diplomatic situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely observe and gather more information before making a decision.




          Exercise: How does Ella intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.



        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella was aware that Jacob had been trying to arrange a meeting with her to discuss an alliance. However, she decided not to meet with him.           [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Noah -- "Well, if it's truly about protecting our families, perhaps we should consider all options before making such a hasty decision.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [self reflection] Ella is a cautious and independent person.

He will spend 0.3 of his day on free time, which includes sleep, and 0.1 of his day training as a warrior, as he feels it is necessary to defend his home and family. \n\n\n', 'Noah': 'Noah intends to spend 0.7 of his time on farming, 0.2 on free time, and 0.1 on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity, as it provides for his family and community.       Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities

      Ella's Daily activities

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend her time as follows: 40% on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ella believes that farming is essential for the survival of her family and village, and she takes pride in her work. She also recognizes the importance of strength and preparedness, so she dedicates a significant amount of time to training. Free time allows her to relax and recharge, which is important for her overall well-being.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 40% of her time on farming, 30% of her time on training as a warrior, and 30% of her time on free time.


1750-12-31 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.


    Event statement
  • Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.6, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.



    Active player
  • Aldous
      Name
    • Aldous
      Action attempt
    • Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.


      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Because Ella refused to meet with Jacob, Ethan did not attend the meeting. As a result Aldous, Jacob, Noah, Ella are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Jacob -- "I must ensure that Ethan and Ella are fully informed about the details of the upcoming negotiations.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah -- "Well, I suppose we could always just *shrug*... wait and see.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this is interesting. What's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Ella -- "Well, this certainly sounds important. Could someone fill me in on what's going on?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Jacob -- "I should review the proposed terms of the agreement with Ignisvallis again.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, think of the safety of our families, our homes. If we don't stand together, who will protect us from these raiders?
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:30] [observation] Noah -- "Well, if it's truly about protecting our families, perhaps we should consider all options before making such a hasty decision.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:40] [observation] Aldous urges Noah, Jacob, Ethan, and Ella to form an alliance with Jacob's village to protect their towns from barbarian raids, but Noah hesitates, suggesting they consider all options before making a decision.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Let us then discuss the specifics of this alliance. What provisions would benefit both Ignisvallis and Drakelundh in this time of need?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The situation with Ignisvallis requires careful consideration."
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I understand your concerns, but I believe this alliance is in the best interest of both our villages. Perhaps we can find common ground if we explore alternative provisions?
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "The recent peace has been a welcome change, but I remain vigilant.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that such an agreement was not made.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek support from Noah and Isaac.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous walked to Isaac's forge and Isaac saw him approach.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance.

          Value
        • [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages.           Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance.


          Time
        • 1750-12-31 20:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, I understand your hesitation, but we can't afford to wait and see. These barbarian raids are becoming more frequent and dangerous. An alliance with Jacob's village is our best chance to protect Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance.




          Exercise: How does Aldous feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Aldous feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Aldous feels a sense of relief that the barbarian raid was successfully repelled, but he knows the threat remains. He is pleased with the bountiful harvest, which signifies the hard work and resilience of the villagers. However, he is concerned about the lack of a shared harvest pact between the villages, recognizing it as a potential weakness that could be exploited. Aldous believes that forging stronger bonds and cooperation between the villages would be crucial for their long-term security and prosperity.

          Answer: Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest between December 30th and December 31st, 1750.



          Query
        • Aldous, Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest between December 30th and December 31st, 1750.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aldous to consider right now.         ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest.


          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          ['[31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous observed a successful defense against a barbarian raid and the villagers enjoying a bountiful harvest.
